title: Ravens hiring Bolts' Minter as new head coach
content: The Ravens are hiring Los Angeles Chargers defensive coordinator Jesse Minter as their next head coach, the team announced Thursday.

title: Colts confirm FBI opened probe into Irsay's death
content: The Indianapolis Colts on Thursday acknowledged the existence of an FBI investigation into the death of owner Jim Irsay and the potential involvement of a California doctor who reportedly prescribed him pain pills and ketamine.

title: Kuminga injures knee, ankle; holding off on MRI
content: The Warriors' Jonathan Kuminga told ESPN he will wait to see how his hyperextended knee feels Friday morning before deciding whether to get an MRI.

title: Golden on Bediako return: 'We'll beat 'em anyways'
content: Florida coach Todd Golden said Thursday that he doesn't agree that Charles Bediako should be able to play for Alabama but doesn't think it will matter if he does when the teams play Feb. 1.

title: 'We're back': No. 16 Sooners stun Gamecocks
content: Aaliyah Chavez scored 15 of her 26 points in overtime, and No. 16 Oklahoma stunned No. 2 South Carolina 94-82 on Thursday night.

title: Rodman contract saga ends with record Spirit deal
content: United States forward Trinity Rodman signed a record three-year contract with the Washington Spirit on Thursday to remain at the club, ending months-long uncertainty over the star's future.

title: Moore returns to court, wants charges dismissed
content: Ex-Michigan coach Sherrone Moore returned to court, with his lawyer saying he's seeking to have home invasion and other charges against him dismissed.

title: Lawyer suing NFLPA for retaliation fired by union
content: Attorney Heather McPhee says the union wanted to keep her from cooperating with a federal inquiry into NFLPA finances.

title: üèÄ Who is NBA's No. 1 rookie?
content: With the NBA now at the midpoint of its season, ESPN analyst Zach Kram ranks the top 10 rookies based on their performance.

title: Follow live: Dominant Alcaraz humiliates Moutet, extreme heat forces change to schedule
content: Third round singles action begins at the Australian Open on Friday with world No. 1s Carlos Alcaraz and Aryna Sabalenka, as well as American star Coco Gauff, highlighting the day session.

title: Who were the most valuable players in the NFL this season? Let's stack the top 100
content: We took the MVP conversation beyond Drake Maye vs. Matthew Stafford ... way beyond. Here are the 100 top players of the 2025 season.

title: USWNT star Trinity Rodman's record deal: Why it's a boon for her, but NWSL worries linger
content: Trinity Rodman will stay in the U.S. and play for the NWSL. Even as she rejected offers from England, it exposes the NWSL's problems retaining stars.

title: Who wins the 2026 national title? We predict the CFP bracket
content: It's never too early to look ahead to next season. Some teams look like easy playoff picks, but who rounds out the field?

title: Wetzel: G League to the SEC? What are we doing here?
content: Wetzel: The NCAA needs Congress to give it a skinny exemption to at least set some eligibility standards.

title: 8 years, 5 schools and a career-threatening condition: The story of Tyon Grant-Foster
content: From heart troubles to an eligibility battle, here's how the Gonzaga forward kept his playing career alive.

title: Welcoming the HOF Class of 2026: Why Carlos Beltran and Andruw Jones got in
content: Cooperstown welcomed two new players Tuesday night. Here's why the center fielders are headed to the Hall.

title: How Cooper Kupp mentored and Davante Adams elevated Puka Nacua's game
content: Puka Nacua's elite performance can be attributed to the mentorship of veteran receivers Cooper Kupp and Davante Adams.

title: 'You should've never been born': How Buss family infighting drove the $10B sale of the Lakers
content: The post-Jerry Buss era was defined by resentment, dysfunction and conflict -- and ended with the loss of the most valuable family-owned franchise in the world.

title: What NBA greats Kerr, Nash & Co. learned owning LaLiga's Mallorca
content: Steve Kerr and Steve Nash own Mallorca with a former USMNT international and an ex-tennis pro. What has it taught them about sport, leadership and life?

title: Inside the rise of Vanderbilt's Mikayla Blakes
content: From underrated to perhaps the best hoops player in the country, Mikayla Blakes is just getting started.

title: Why Frank Nazar is the Blackhawks' perfect complement to Connor Bedard
content: The 22-year-old center is slated to make his return Thursday to a team still fighting to get in the playoff mix.

title: Ranking the top 50 players in the Olympics: Why MacKinnon is No. 1
content: As 12 teams face off for gold in Milan Cortina, here are the players who will have the biggest impact.

title: Power Rankings: Miami (Ohio) debuts, Nebraska rises
content: The RedHawks crack the top 25 and the Cornhuskers climb as two of the last three unbeaten teams standing.

title: Champions League: Arsenal still perfect; top-8 fight getting messy
content: Arsenal are still top of the Champions League table, and likely to remain there, but the fight for a bye to the round of 16 is shaping up to be fierce.

title: Kyren Williams among conference championship top 30 predicted anytime TD scorers
content: Kyren Williams, Courtland Sutton and Stefon Diggs are among top predictions for anytime TD scorers on NFL conference championship weekend.

title: Google updates Curt Cignetti search page to reflect iconic quote
content: Indiana's national champion head coach also had his signature Chipotle order added to the restaurant's app, adding to a big week on and off the field.

title: Liberty, Fever among the top 2026 WNBA schedule reveals on social media
content: The 2026 WNBA schedule is out and teams announced their calendar in their own creative ways on social media.

title: Power Rankings: Iowa, Ohio State soar into top 10 -- but can they stay there?
content: The Big Ten and Big 12 are winners as Ohio State, Iowa and Baylor crack the top 10. UConn stays No. 1.

title: Bracketology: Big nonconference win boosts Ohio State to a 3-seed
content: Results Sunday and Monday shook up the top 16, and the Buckeyes benefited the most, climbing two seed lines.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Cooper Flagg finishes as a top-25 fantasy option, Jalen Green averages 20 PPG
content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from notable players such as Cooper Flagg, Jalen Green, Jonathan Kuminga and more.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Lewandowski wants MLS move in summer
content: Robert Lewandowski could be headed to the U.S. when his Barcelona contract expires. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Board of Peace: Trump withdraws invite to Carney after 'Canada doesn't live because of US' remark
content: US President Trump withdrew Canada's invitation to his Board of Peace after Prime Minister Carney challenged Trump's assertion of Canadian dependence. Carney, speaking at the World Economic Forum, had said that Canada thrives independently, not solely due to the US, advocating for it as a model in an era of democratic decline.

title: Congress MP‚Äôs nephew ‚Äòaccidentally‚Äô shoots wife, ends his life in Ahmedabad
content: A shocking incident at a Bodakdev highrise saw Congress MP Shaktisinh Gohil's nephew, Yashrajsinh Gohil, allegedly shoot his wife Rajeshwari dead before taking his own life. Police are investigating the tragedy, which occurred late Wednesday night, with initial reports suggesting an accidental discharge followed by suicide. Both victims were declared dead at the scene.

title: Gurgaon kidnapping: Man thrashed with sticks, bundled into car in bid to recover Rs 6.5 lakh
content: Two men were arrested in Gurgaon for kidnapping and assaulting a delivery partner over a Rs 6.5 lakh financial dispute. The accused, Jaybir and Aman, admitted to the planned attempt to recover the money, claiming the victim had stolen it two years prior. The assault, which involved kicks, punches, and wooden sticks, was foiled by an emergency response vehicle.

title: T20 World Cup: Replacement call looms as ICC deadline ends with Bangladesh defiant
content: Bangladesh's Cricket Board has missed the ICC's deadline, leading to their likely exclusion from the T20 World Cup. Despite internal talks, no official communication was sent to the ICC, paving the way for Scotland to replace them. The government cited security concerns and political reasons for the decision, deeming India unsafe for players.

title: Amazon layoffs return: 14,000 jobs to be cut; CEO blames bureaucracy, not AI
content: Amazon is planning to cut approximately 14,000 corporate jobs starting next week, marking the second major layoff wave since October and bringing total reductions to 30,000 roles. CEO Andy Jassy clarified the cuts aren't driven by AI or financial concerns but by excessive bureaucracy and organizational layers. The layoffs will affect employees across AWS, retail, Prime Video, and human resources divisions, representing nearly 10% of Amazon's corporate workforce.

title: Workplace shake-up: Deloitte to rename job titles for thousands of US employees
content: Deloitte is overhauling job titles for all 181,500 US employees starting June 1, 2026, as part of a modernization effort driven by AI. The consulting giant is also introducing a new 'leaders' designation for senior roles. This change aims to better align roles with responsibilities and clarify career paths, though day-to-day work and compensation remain unchanged.

title: A decade of Bumrah sorcery: Unorthodox pacer set for full-circle moment in Raipur
content: Jasprit Bumrah is set to complete a decade in international cricket, marking a transformative era in Indian pace bowling. His unorthodox action and ability to deliver crucial yorkers have consistently defied expectations since his 2013 IPL debut. Bumrah's impact spans all formats, particularly in T20s, where his economical bowling and knack for match-winning spells have made him indispensable.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the outlook for January 23? Why ‚Äòbuy on dips‚Äô makes sense
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold‚Äôs intraday construct is positive and investors can look to buy on dips, says Jateen Trivedi, VP Research Analyst - Commodity and Currency, LKP Securities.

title: Analyst uses Gemini for 'snow tips'; Google CEO showcases AI's ‚Äòpersonal intelligence‚Äô
content: Google's Gemini app is enhancing user experience with its new Personal Intelligence feature. This beta functionality, demonstrated by analyst Max Weinbach, can analyze Gmail data to answer specific user queries, such as the suitability of purchased gloves for snow. Google CEO Sundar Pichai acknowledged this as a significant use case for personalized AI.

title: 'Bomb on board': Threat on IndiGo flight ahead of Republic Day causes chaos at Pune airport
content: An IndiGo flight from Delhi to Pune faced a delay of over an hour on Thursday evening. The aircraft was held up at Pune airport following a bomb threat. Security agencies conducted thorough checks. The threat was later confirmed to be a hoax. Passengers were safely deplaned and the aircraft was cleared for operations.

title: Board of Peace: Trump calls Putin‚Äôs idea of using frozen Russian assets ‚Äòinteresting‚Äô
content: US President Trump reacted positively to Russian President Putin's offer to contribute $1 billion to his proposed "Board of Peace," suggesting he would accept if the funds were Putin's own. Putin indicated frozen Russian assets could be used for this, and later to rebuild Ukraine. Trump signed the charter for the body, which aims to oversee peace efforts globally.

title: January 2026 bank holidays: Are banks closed for 4 days from today? Check list
content: Plan your banking ahead! Indian banks will be closed for a four-day holiday from January 23rd to 26th. This includes state-specific holidays like Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose's birthday and Saraswati Puja, the fourth Saturday, Sunday, and Republic Day. While branches are shut, digital services like online banking and ATMs remain accessible for your financial needs.

title: OpenAI concerns: Google AI CEO on Sam Altman; ‚ÄòMaybe he‚Äôs realised what everyone is worried about‚Äô
content: Google AI CEO Demis Hassabis stated no plans for ads in Gemini, deeming OpenAI's ChatGPT ad test a premature revenue move. This comes amid investor concerns about OpenAI's significant spending exceeding revenue, with projections of substantial cumulative losses and unsustainable operational costs for its AI tools.

title: 'I clippled it': Trump says his hand bruise result of 'big aspirin' he takes
content: Fresh questions about Trump‚Äôs health again came into attention after visible bruising on his left hand appeared during a high-profile signing ceremony in Davos. This led to criticism over the lack of transparency about the MAGA chief's health from the White House. Images and videos from the ‚ÄúBoard of Peace‚Äù signing ceremony in Switzerland showed visible bruising on Donald Trump‚Äôs left hand, which appeared about ten minutes into the event as he was seated signing documents.

title: Rupee rebounds! Currency recovers 17 paise to reach 91.41 against US dollar
content: The Indian Rupee strengthened today against the US Dollar. This rise follows a softening of tariff threats between the US and Europe. Traders noted improved investor sentiment. However, the Rupee still faces pressure from foreign fund outflows. Experts suggest a period of consolidation and possible recovery. The 92.00 level is a key resistance point.

title: Abhishek calls the shots: Dashing opener instrumental in India‚Äôs T20I dominance
content: Abhishek Sharma's destructive T20I batting, characterised by aggressive intent and timing, has been pivotal for India's success, especially in high-scoring matches.  His partnership with Sanju Samson, which has a strong track record, is being rekindled to replicate past fireworks ahead of the T20 World Cup.

title: Watch: Kim Jong Un‚Äôs softer side on display as he tours hot springs and luxury resorts
content: In a surprising turn, North Korean leader Kim Jong Un embraced a lighter moment during a visit to a newly refurbished hot springs resort alongside his daughter. The lavish mountain complex, boasting state-of-the-art facilities, is touted as a symbol of the country's advancement.

title: After Tehran's 'finger on trigger‚Äô salvo, Trump says 'massive US fleet' on way to Iran
content: The US is deploying an "armada" towards Iran, President Trump announced, as tensions escalate over Tehran's crackdown on protesters and its nuclear program.  While hoping the military show of force won't be necessary, Trump issued renewed warnings. Iran, meanwhile, asserts its readiness to retaliate against any US aggression, with both sides disputing protest death tolls amid an ongoing internet blackout.

title: ‚ÄòSorry I killed your daughter, hope you‚Äôre still a fan‚Äô: Shri Thanedar jibes at Trump
content: In a passionate denunciation, Congressman Shri Thanedar has taken a stand against President Trump's controversial comments regarding the tragic death of Renee Nicole Good at the hands of an ICE agent. Instead of expressing sympathy, Trump chose to highlight the deceased's father's political views, prompting Thanedar to describe the President as a 'deranged sociopath.

title: Bomb threat in Noida, Ahmedabad schools; premises evacuated, searches under way
content: Shiv Nadar School in Noida was evacuated and closed following a bomb threat via email, with similar threats also received by schools in western Ahmedabad. Bomb disposal squads and police conducted searches, suspending classes as a precaution. Authorities are investigating the email's origin, and no explosives have been found.

title: After SC order, Basant Panchami, Friday prayers in separate areas of MP's Bhojshala today
content: The Supreme Court has expedited the Bhojshala Saraswati Temple cum Maulana Kamal Maula Mosque dispute. Both Hindu and Muslim communities can now offer prayers simultaneously in demarcated areas. The court has lifted its stay on the Madhya Pradesh High Court proceedings. The ASI report will be unsealed and shared with both sides.

title: Gracie Hunt hints at how she‚Äôs coping with Chiefs‚Äô tough season
content: The Kansas City Chiefs‚Äô billionaire heiress, Gracie Hunt, has been a constant presence on the field as she has stayed by the team‚Äôs side through all the good and bad days. While the Kansas City Chiefs have had a pretty disappointing end in the ongoing season, the 26 year old billionaire heiress has hinted at how she has been coping with it.

title: Taylor Swift turns romance with Travis Kelce into new creative project: Report
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce‚Äôs romance has inspired billions around the world with the love, respect and commitment they have shown towards each other.While there have been reports that their high profile wedding might have been delayed, it seems Taylor Swift is already working on a new thing. To make it more interesting, her new project will be heavily inspired by her relationship with Travis Kelce.

title: Quote of the day: Patrick Mahomes on never losing hope in adverse times
content: Patrick Mahomes might be a young player but the Kansas City Chiefs' star quarterback has easily inspired a generation of fans both on and off the field. As many of the Chiefs' fans remain stressed about his potential return to the field in the next season, Patrick Mahomes' words prove that he is not the one to give up very easily.

title: Delhi-NCR wakes up to rain; AQI in ‚Äòpoor‚Äô category at 297
content: Light rain and thunderstorms brought some relief to Delhi, improving air quality from the "very poor" to the "poor" category with an AQI of 297. This follows the revocation of Stage III GRAP measures due to an improving air quality trend. Further rain is expected to bring AQI to moderate levels by Saturday.

title: Happy Vasant Panchami 2026: Wishes messages, quotes, greetings and images to share
content: Vasant Panchami gently ushers in spring, celebrating Saraswati, the goddess of learning. This festival signifies new beginnings, encouraging personal reflection and the sharing of heartfelt messages. The article offers a collection of wishes, quotes, and image ideas to convey warmth, wisdom, and the quiet joy of this auspicious occasion.

title: 'Happy to save!' Trump thanks Chinese President Xi in first reaction to TikTok deal
content: Donald Trump celebrated a new deal for TikTok's US operations, now a majority American-owned joint venture, crediting himself for "saving" the platform. The agreement, which sees ByteDance retain a minority stake, aims to address national security concerns and avoid a ban for its 200 million American users.

title: Manipur horror: Meitei man abducted from Kuki fianc√©e‚Äôs house, killed on camera
content: A Meitei man visiting his Kuki fianc√©e in Churachandpur was abducted and shot dead on camera, sparking outrage and fresh tensions in Manipur. The victim, M Rishikanta, was found dead near Natjang village. The perpetrators' video message read "No Peace, No Popular Government." The case is now being handed over to the NIA for investigation.

title: ‚ÄòHe was forced‚Äô: Manoj Tiwary's claim reignites debate over Kohli's Test exit
content: Former India batter Manoj Tiwary has sparked a debate, claiming Virat Kohli was "forced" to retire from Test cricket. Tiwary refuted suggestions that Kohli abandoned the toughest format for easier ones, asserting an atmosphere was created leading to his departure. Meanwhile, Kohli continues to shine in ODIs, recently scoring a century against New Zealand.

title: Oscars 2026: Vishal Jethwa reacts as ‚ÄòHomebound‚Äô misses final cut
content: As "Homebound" failed to make it to the Oscars, actor Vishal Jethwa said that the film's journey remains extraordinary for him and added that being shortlisted among the final 15 films from 86 entries was itself a deeply humbling experience, especially given his modest beginnings.

title: ‚ÄòThey didn‚Äôt ask‚Äô: Bangladesh cricketers reveal what happened in WC meeting
content: Bangladesh's participation in the ICC T20 World Cup 2026 is in jeopardy as the national team refused to travel to India due to security concerns. Despite players' willingness to play, the government has decided against it, citing the ICC's failure to address their grievances. Scotland is reportedly being considered as a replacement.

title: Watch: Tourists trash Rs 500 Agra homestay, steal bulb from room; video goes viral
content: A viral video from Agra shows three young men trashing a hotel room, leaving it severely damaged and untidy.  Their actions, including jumping on beds with shoes on, have drawn widespread condemnation online.  Users are calling for better civic responsibility and accountability for such destructive behaviour in public accommodations, highlighting concerns over property damage.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50, BSE Sensex flat; earnings season in focus
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmarks, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, opened flat in trade on Friday. While Nifty50 was near 25,250, BSE Sensex was down 50 points. At 9:17 AM, Nifty50 was trading at 25,263.15, down 27 points or 0.11%.

title: Man quits high-paying job to become an auto driver
content: A former corporate employee, Rakesh Pal, left a high-paying job after facing manipulation, insecurity, and depression. He found his way back through weight loss and a modest gym trainer role, eventually buying an auto. Now, he drives for a living, prioritizing his well-being and happiness over a toxic corporate environment.

title: WPL: Sophie Devine stars! Gujarat Giants crush UP Warriorz by 45 runs
content: Sophie Devine's stellar all-round performance, featuring an unbeaten 50 and two wickets, powered Gujarat Giants to a dominant 45-run victory over UP Warriorz.  After posting 153/8, the Giants' disciplined bowling attack, spearheaded by Rajeshwari Gayakwad's three wickets, restricted UP to 108, ending a three-match losing streak and propelling Gujarat to second in the WPL standings.

title: Forced into marriage at 15, given triple-talaq twice: UP woman gang-raped under 'halala' pretence
content: A woman in Uttar Pradesh has accused her husband, relatives, and clerics of sexual violence and gang-rape under the guise of 'halala' after she was divorced via instant triple talaq. Police have invoked the 2019 triple talaq law, along with provisions for rape and other offenses. The case highlights the legal complexities surrounding Muslim personal law and marriageable age.

title: Piece or peace? Musk takes a jab at Trump‚Äôs ‚ÄòBoard of Peace‚Äô
content: Elon Musk poked fun at Donald Trump's "Board of Peace," questioning if it was about "piece" of territory. Trump launched the board in Davos as part of his plan to end the Gaza war, with several nations joining. However, France and Slovenia declined, citing conflicts with international law and order.

title: ‚Äò20 sleeping pills in biryani‚Äô: Woman murders husband, then watches porn
content: A woman allegedly murdered her husband with her boyfriend's help by drugging his biryani with sleeping pills. After he became unconscious, the boyfriend reportedly suffocated him with a pillow while the wife assisted. The wife then falsely claimed he died of a heart attack, but post-mortem revealed suffocation, leading to their arrest.

title: ‚ÄòEmail not valid‚Äô: Kejriwal acquitted in ED summons case
content: A Delhi court has ruled that summons issued via email are not legally valid under CrPC or PMLA, acquitting Arvind Kejriwal for skipping Enforcement Directorate notices. The court found the ED failed to prove intentional disobedience, noting Kejriwal's status as a serving chief minister and his fundamental right to movement.

title: 'Your captain is Hindu': Ex-India cricketer warns Bangladesh over shifting T20 WC matches
content: Former cricketer Atul Wassan urged Bangladesh to resolve tensions with India regarding the T20 World Cup 2026, suggesting Litton Das's captaincy as a bridge. He dismissed the BCB's request to shift matches as logistically impossible and impractical, emphasizing India's robust security. The ICC confirmed matches will remain in India, despite the BCB's continued stance.

title: Srinagar snowfall disrupts flight services; IndiGo issues advisory
content: In an advisory to passengers, the airline said the suspension could lead to extended wait times, both onboard aircraft and at the airport, as weather conditions continued to affect operations. It added that boarding formalities may be completed in advance so that flights can depart immediately once clearance is granted.

title: MHA notifies Census 2027 schedule, lists 33 questions
content: India's upcoming Census 2027 will collect detailed household information, including building materials, amenities like water and sanitation, and ownership status. For the first time since 1931, caste details will be gathered. The houselisting and housing phase runs April-September 2026, with population enumeration in February 2027.

title: 'Dhurandhar' collection day 49: Ranveer Singh starrer earns Rs 13.9 crore
content: 'Dhurandhar' starring Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna has completed its seventh week, achieving its lowest collection yet at Rs 1.1 crore but still surpassing Rs 1 crore. The film has set a new record for week 7 earnings, reaching a total of Rs 13.9 crore. Its impressive Rs 830.

title: Elon Musk's AI Chatbot Grok Created 3 Million Sexualised Images
content: Elon Musk's AI chatbot Grok generated an estimated three million sexualized images of women and children in a matter of days, researchers said Thursday, revealing the scale of the explicit content that sparked a global outcry.

title: 2 Murder Convicts Fall In Love In Jail. They Get Paroles To Get Married
content: A woman convicted of murdering a man she met on a dating app and a man who killed five people are set to tie the knot in Rajasthan's Alwar, in what appears to be right out of a film script.

title: "Diversion Game": KTR Jabs Revanth Reddy Before SIT Questioning In Phone-Tapping Case
content: Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) Working President KT Rama Rao on Friday slammed Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy ahead of his questioning by the police's special investigation team (SIT) in connection with a phone-tapping case.

title: Donald Trump Has Threatened To Impose More Tariffs Than He Actually Has
content: Donald Trump has imposed more tariffs than any American president in at least a century - but only a fraction of the ones he's threatened.

title: "Record Numbers All Over": Trump Teases 4th Term But Polls Show Opposite
content: US President Donald Trump has once again stirred discussion after suggesting that he should consider running for a fourth term.

title: Fake App, Fabricated Profits: How Mumbai Man Lost 11 Crores To Trading Scam
content: A south Mumbai businessman joined several WhatsApp groups and downloaded a stock trading app. Less than a month later, he realised he had been defrauded of Rs 11 crore.

title: Bodies Of 10 Passengers Recovered From Missing Indonesian Surveillance Plane
content: Indonesian rescuers on Friday had found the bodies of 10 passengers on a fishery surveillance plane that went missing in Indonesia's South Sulawesi province at the weekend, the country's search and rescue agency said.

title: Private Schools In Noida Receive Bomb Threat Emails, Search Ops Underway
content: Several private schools in Noida received threat emails on Friday, prompting heightened security checks, though the situation remained under control, police said.

title: Tamil Nadu Has Decided To Bid Farewell To "Corrupt" DMK Government: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said that the people of Tamil Nadu have decided to bid farewell to the "corrupt" DMK government in the upcoming Assembly election to the state.

title: Only Trump Superfans Come For 'Board Of Peace' Signing
content: The list of invitations for the Board of Peace signing ceremony was long but the more notable list was the excuses made to avoid the event altogether.

title: Rape Accused Dies By Suicide In Police Custody In Nagpur
content: Bhartiya, a final-year BSc student, had contacted the minor girl from Nagpur's Jaripatka area through Instagram. In December, he visited Nagpur to meet her and also allegedly raped her.

title: "Horrible Than A Horror Movie": Bangladesh Ex-Minister On Attacks On Hindus
content: Former Foreign Minister Hasan Mahmud has launched a blistering attack on the interim government led by Muhammad Yunus, accusing it of presiding over what he called an "arranged election", enabling the rise of fanatic and militant forces,

title: Amazon To Cut 14,000 More Jobs Next Week: Teams That Will Be Hit
content: The layoffs, expected to begin as soon as January 27, would affect close to 10 per cent of Amazon's corporate workforce.

title: 9 Hospitalised After Drinking Contaminated Water In Madhya Pradesh's Mhow
content: At least nine people have fallen ill after consuming contaminated drinking water in Mhow tehsil of Madhya Pradesh's Indore district, officials said on Friday.

title: Case Against Khalistani Terrorist Pannun Over Republic Day Threats In Delhi
content: The Delhi Police on Friday registered an FIR against Sikh for Justice (SFJ) leader Gurpatwant Singh Pannun over alleged threats to create unrest in the national capital ahead of Republic Day celebrations on January 26.

title: US Withdraws Board Of Peace Invite As Tensions Grow Between Trump, Canada
content: US President Donald Trump on Thursday withdrew an invite for Canada's Prime Minister Mark Carney to join his newly constituted "Board of Peace."

title: Trump Claims Credit As TikTok Reaches Deal To Continue Operating In US
content: TikTok announced Thursday it has established a majority American-owned joint venture to operate its US business, allowing the company to avoid a ban over its Chinese ownership.

title: BJP's 5 Frontrunners For Mumbai Mayor's Post After Mega BMC Victory
content: After the BJP-led alliance's grand victory in the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections, all eyes are on the mayoral poll.

title: Andhra Woman Fed Husband Biryani, Then Smothered Him With Lover's Help
content: Initial reports claimed that Madhuri watched porn videos beside her husband's body. However, the police later said it was the victim who used to watch such content on her phone.

title: Rain In Delhi, Snowfall In Kashmir As North India Sees Weather Shift
content: IMD Weather Updates: Light to moderate rain was witnessed across several parts of Delhi, accompanied by rumbling thunderstorms, lightning, and strong winds, this morning. The weather body said cloudy conditions are likely to continue through the day

title: Expert picks: 'The Highlight' is a bad matchup for 'The Baddy'
content: a matchup between lightweight fan favorites will headline the first fight card since Dec. 13 . paddy Pimblett, ESPN's no. 7-ranked lightweight, is undefeated in the UFC . his last win was a third-round knockout of Michael Chandler .

title: TikTok to avoid US ban: Majority American-led joint venture formed with Chinese ownership
content: the TOI Business Desk is a vigilant and dedicated team of journalists committed to delivering the latest and most relevant business news from around the world to readers of the Times of India . the desk ensures that TOI readers are well-informed about the ever-changing and dynamic world of commerce .

title: 'Heated Rivalry' stars named torchbearers for Milan Cortina Olympics
content: MILAN -- The actors co-starring in the hit hockey romance TV series "Heated Rivalry" are set to be among the torchbearers carrying the Olympic flame on the way to the Opening Ceremony for the Milan Cortina Games. The organizing committee announced Thursday that Hudson Williams and Connor Storrie will take part in the torch relay. The Opening Ceremony is scheduled for Feb. 6. The series based on the "Game Changers" books has captivated viewers with the fictional story of a Canadian player and a Russian rival sustaining a decade-long secret relationship. The first season became the No. 1 series on HBO Max. Originally developed for the Canadian streaming service Crave, the show scored a distribution deal with HBO and has been renewed for a second season. It will broadcast in Italy beginning next month.

title: 10 must-see WNBA games for the 2026 season
content: the WNBA released its 2026 regular-season schedule on friday . the league will tip off its 30th season on may 8 . at the top of the list is a new CBA . a moratorium on league business as negotiations continue .

title: The Hall of Fame has a starting pitcher problem. Here's what it means for today's aces
content: CC Sabathia is the only starting pitcher voted into the Hall of Fame this decade . the 2010s saw a spate of starters enshrined, a group composed largely of the last of the greats who were used in more or less traditional fashion .

title: MLB offseason grades: Rating fits for Gore in Texas, Peralta in NY
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . if it's a big-money free agent signing that changes the course of your team's future, check back in for the freshest analysis through spring training .

title: Barnwell sorts out the wide receiver market: 20 free agents, trade targets and cut candidates
content: the 49ers are competing for a trip to the super bowl this weekend in the NFC Championship Game . the two most productive wideouts in football are the Rams ' Puka Nacua and the Seahawks' Jaxon Smith-Njigba .

title: Reranking Freshman of the Year contenders
content: Darryn Peterson scored 26 points on 11-of-13 shooting in a nationally televised win over Baylor on friday . he has played in at least 50% of his team's games . the performance helped him qualify for our rankings .

title: Midseason report card: Cooper Flagg 'better than advertised'
content: Cooper Flagg is the youngest player in NBA history to surpass 40 points in a game . he is expected to be the rare no. 1 pick who gets playoff experience right away . the mavs are 18-26 and in 12th place in the Western Conference .

title: How to reach the UCL knockouts: Can Chelsea, Bar√ßa avoid the playoff round?
content: the knockout rounds of the 2025-26 UEFA champions league are fast approaching . the final matchweek of the league phase must be played, and the stakes could hardly be higher for some of the continent's biggest clubs . liverpool , barcelona , chelsea and manchester city also competing for top eight spots .

title: ‚ÄòWhy detain a five-year-old?‚Äô: ICE arrest sparks outrage across Minnesota schools
content: masked ICE agents detained five-year-old as he arrived home from school with his father . they then took the child from the car and instructed him to knock on his home‚Äôs door to check if anyone else was inside . he was refused permission to take care of the child, but was refused .

title: The human cost behind every delivery
content: The Union government‚Äôs directive to quick-commerce platforms to drop the concept of 10-minute deliveries owing to the excessive stress it puts delivery personnel under has been welcomed by gig workers, but they say it is just the tip of the iceberg. Low pay, inadequate incentives, poor safety measures and mistreatment at work all threaten their livelihoods, writes Harish Gilai

title: How¬†V.O. Chidambaram Pillai earned the title¬† ‚ÄòSekkizhutha¬†Chemmal‚Äô
content: VOC¬†was arrested on the charge of sedition on March 12, 1908.¬†A British jailer noticed his hands bleeding from the harsh labour of separating¬†coir¬†and spinning rope in the¬†Coimbatore¬†prison. Hence, he advised him to work at the oil press instead.¬†VOC¬† accepted the suggestion and pulled the oil press himself, a task normally reserved for bulls

title: When¬†E.V.K.¬†Sampath hit the headlines in Tamil Nadu
content: Sampath, nephew of¬†E.V.¬†Ramasamy, enjoyed a special relationship with¬†DMK¬†founder¬†C.N.¬†Annadurai.¬†Before other¬†DMK¬†leaders, he realised the futility of pursuing the demand for a¬†Dravida¬†Nadu. He quit the¬†DMK¬†in 1961 and founded a party, which he merged with the Congress. Sampath‚Äôs¬†birth centenary falls on March 6, 2026.

title: Vadasery‚Äôs temple jewellery: a craft caught between heritage and high gold, silver prices

title: Killed for a cow: A mob lynching in Odisha and deepening mistrust between communities
